Technique: BURNED, OXIDIZED; FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE
Name: Amphora
Description: Pear-shaped amphora with a narrowing at the bottom. Narrow mouth and straight rim with collar and long neck. It has a ribbon handle which starts at the neck and ends at the top of the body. Paste of a reddish colour and surface with remnants of a coating, also reddish in colour.
